definition: to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
cause/reason/because
disaster/misfortune/calamity
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: It is such a blessing in disguise that he got the love from the gal.
sentences.chinese: 不過卻因禍得福得到了受他幫助的那個女孩的愛。

sentences.english: Mother and daughter survived because the mother did the right thing for the wrong reasons.
sentences.chinese: 母女倆倖存下來是因爲那位母親因禍得福。

sentences.english: Being laid-off from that job turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 從那個工作中被解僱，結果卻成了一件因禍得福的事。

sentences.english: Being cut loose was a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 被開除對我來說是因禍得福。

definition: variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to get sth done once and for all
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
(fig.) history full of suffering/heart-rending story/CL:部[bu4]
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
fortunes rise and fall/times change
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
well-tried/time-tested
to stay young forever
